InputProperty.label: Active Resource
InputProperty.name: ActiveResource
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies which algorithm generates the active resource's visualization data. This is used to register resources on the server and synchronize data between the client and server.

InputProperty.label: Selected Port
InputProperty.name: SelectedPort
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the dataset which has most recently had a user specify a selection. When a JSON request is issued to transfer the ParaView selection to SMTK, it is this data that the vtkSelection refers to.

InputProperty.label: Selection Object
InputProperty.name: SelectionObj
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the selection a user most recently made. When a JSON request is issued to transfer the ParaView selection to SMTK, it is this vtkSelection that is used.

ProxyProperty.name: Representation
ProxyProperty.Documentation: This property is used by the resource manager to invoke methods on representations.

Documentation.short_help: A proxy for an SMTK resource.
Documentation.long_help: A proxy for an SMTK resource.

StringVectorProperty.name: ResourceId
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A string representation of a resource Id.

Documentation.long_help: Read an SMTK file as a set of multiblock datasets.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The path to an SMTK JSON file to read.

Documentation.long_help: Create a new SMTK resource and represent it as a set of multiblock datasets.
Import a file as a set of multiblock datasets.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The path of a file to read.

Documentation.long_help: Read an SMTK attribute file as a set of multiblock datasets.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The path to an SMTK XML file to read.

Documentation.long_help: Read an CMB Geometry file (several different file formats).

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the file name for the reader.

ReaderFactory.extensions: fac obj poly smesh pts sol stl tin xyz

Documentation.short_help: Construct a vtk source from an SMTK resource.
Documentation.long_help: Read an SMTK Resource file as a set of multiblock datasets.
Read an SMTK Resource file as a set of multiblock datasets.
Import a file as an SMTK Resource.
Read an SMTK attribute file as a set of multiblock datasets.

SourceProxy.name: LIDARReader
SourceProxy.label: LIDAR reader
SourceProxy.Documentation: long_help="Read a file of format (pts xyz bin.pts or bin) for LIDAR object"

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Origin
DoubleVectorProperty.label: change the origin
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: subtracts off the value.

StringVectorProperty.name: FileName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the file name for the reader.

IntVectorProperty.name: PieceIndex
IntVectorProperty.label: Piece Index
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The index of the piece to set/get values for.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Transform
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Piece Transformation
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Transformation matrix for transforming points after they are read in. Row major.

IntVectorProperty.name: AbortExecute
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: vtkAlgorithm::SetAbortExecute()

Documentation.long_help: Calculate the statistics of a PolyDataSet.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: AreaStats
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Area Statistics
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Area Result of the PolyDataSet Statistic calculation.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: GeometryBounds
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Geometry Bounds
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Geometric Bounds Result of the PolyDataSet Statistic calculation.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: PolygonalSideStats
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Polygonal Side Statistics
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Polygonal Side Result of the PolyDataSet Statistic calculation.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Translation
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Translation
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Defines the translation from data space to world space.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Orientation
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Orientation
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Defines the orientation from data space to world space.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Scale
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Scale
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Defines the scale from data space to world space.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input to the Terrain Extraction filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputPtsFormat
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls the which of the three output formats to use.

IntVectorProperty.name: ExecuteMode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Controls the which of the two modes/steps to execute.

IntVectorProperty.name: MinExtractLevel
IntVectorProperty.label: Minimum Extract Level
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The minimum extraction level.

IntVectorProperty.name: MaxExtractLevel
IntVectorProperty.label: Maximum Extract Level
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The maximum extraction level.

IntVectorProperty.name: AbortExecute
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: vtkAlgorithm::SetAbortExecute()

IntVectorProperty.name: RefineVisualizationOutputMode
IntVectorProperty.label: Refine Visualization Output Mode
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Control if (and how) refine visualization output is generated.

IntVectorProperty.name: WriteExtractionResultsToDisk
IntVectorProperty.label: Write Extraction Results to Disk
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Indicate whether to write Extract phase results to disk.

IntVectorProperty.name: CacheRefineResultsToDisk
IntVectorProperty.label: Cache Refine Results To Disk
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Indicate whether to cache Refine phase results to disk.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeDataTransform
IntVectorProperty.label: Compute the transform during Setup Refine Stage
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Indicate whether to compute the internal transform during Setup Refine stage

DoubleVectorProperty.name: SetDataTransform
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Set Data Transform
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Transformation matrix to apply to points before and after (inverse) extraction calculation

IntVectorProperty.name: SetComputeInitialScale
IntVectorProperty.label: Compute The Initial Scale During Setup Refine Stage
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Indicate whether to compute the initial scale during Setup Refine stage

DoubleVectorProperty.name: SetInitialScale
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Resolution of the points in the extraction grid
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Resolution of the points in the extraction grid

DoubleVectorProperty.name: SetMaskSize
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Mask Size of the refine stage
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Resolution of the mask size

IntVectorProperty.name: DetermineIntensityAndColor
IntVectorProperty.label: Determine Intensity and Color for Output from Input
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Indicate whether to use memory and time resources to find nearest point in input to extract color and intensity info (if present).

SourceProxy.name: LIDARElevationFilter
SourceProxy.label: LIDARElevation

Documentation.long_help: Create point attribute array by projecting points onto an elevation vector.
Documentation.short_help: Create a point array representing elevation.

SourceProxy.Documentation:
The Elevation filter generates point scalar values for an input dataset along a specified direction vector.
The Input menu allows the user to select the data set to which this filter will be applied. Use the Scalar range entry boxes to specify the minimum and maximum scalar value to be generated. The Low Point and High Point define a line onto which each point of the data set is projected. The minimum scalar value is associated with the Low Point, and the maximum scalar value is associated with the High Point. The scalar value for each point in the data set is determined by the location along the line to which that point projects.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input dataset to the Elevation filter.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Transform
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Transformation
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Transformation matrix to apply to points before assigning a scalar value.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ScalarRange
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines the range into which scalars will be mapped.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: LowPoint
DoubleVectorProperty.label: Low Point
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property defines one end of the direction vector (small scalar values).

DoubleVectorProperty.name: HighPoint
DoubleVectorProperty.label: High Point
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property defines the other end of the direction vector (large scalar values).

RepresentationProxy.name: SMTKModelRepresentation
RepresentationProxy.Documentation: This specialized representation uses extended functionality of the composite mapper to better integrate with SMTKModel. Handles selection of SMTK components.

IntVectorProperty.name: Visibility
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Get/Set the visibility of the representation.

StringVectorProperty.name: ColorArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the array to color with. One must specify the field association and the array name of the array. If the array is missing, scalar coloring will automatically be disabled.

ProxyProperty.name: LookupTable
ProxyProperty.Documentation: Set the lookup-table to use to map data array to colors. Lookuptable is only used with MapScalars to ON.

IntVectorProperty.name: MapScalars
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When set to True, LookupTable will always be used for scalar mapping. Otherwise, when up to 4 component scalars are present, the components are clamped to a valid color interval (0-255 for an integral type and 0.0-1.0 for a floating point type) and then directly used as color.

IntVectorProperty.name: InterpolateScalarsBeforeMapping
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When set to true (default), texture coordinates are sent to and interpolated by the graphics card. This is equivalent with interpolating scalars and then mapping them to obtain colors between points. Otherwise, colors are sent to and interpolated by the graphics card.

StringVectorProperty.name: ColorBy
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: components can be colored in different ways: using the color defined on the entity (Entity); or using the color defined by the volume bounded by the entity (Volume); or mapping field values (scalars) defined on points or cells through a color lookup table (Field),

DoubleVectorProperty.name: UserTransform
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: In addition to the instance variables such as position and orientation, you can add an additional transformation for your own use. This transformation is concatenated with the actor's internal transformation, which you implicitly create through the use of Position, Origin, Orientation. The value is 4x4 matrix for the linear tranform to use.

IntVectorProperty.name: BlockVisibility
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the visibility for a block. Value is (property, visibility).

DoubleMapProperty.name: BlockColor
DoubleMapProperty.Documentation: Set the color for a block. Value is (index, r, g, b).

DoubleMapProperty.name: BlockOpacity
DoubleMapProperty.Documentation: Set the opacity for a block. Value is (index, alpha).

IntVectorProperty.name: InstanceVisibility
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the visibility for an instance point block (glyph). Value is (property, visibility).

DoubleMapProperty.name: InstanceColor
DoubleMapProperty.Documentation: Set the color for an instance point block (glyph). Value is (index, r, g, b).

IntVectorProperty.name: UseInternalAttributes
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Use block attributes set through proxy properties.

SMTKModelRepresentationProxy.name: SMTKModelCompositeRepresentation
SMTKModelRepresentationProxy.Documentation: SMTK's default representation. It is a stripped down version of PVRepresentationBase (selection is handled by SMTKModelRepresentation).

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input to the representation.

IntVectorProperty.name: Visibility
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the visibility for this representation.

IntVectorProperty.name: ForceUseCache
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Typically UseCache and CacheKey are updated by the View and representations cache based on what the view tells it. However in some cases we may want to force a representation to cache irrespective of the view (e.g. comparative views). In which case these ivars can up set. If ForcedCacheKey is true, it overrides UseCache and CacheKey. Instead, ForcedCacheKey is used.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ForcedCacheKey
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Typically UseCache and CacheKey are updated by the View and representations cache based on what the view tells it. However in some cases we may want to force a representation to cache irrespective of the view (e.g. comparative views). In which case these ivars can up set. If ForcedCacheKey is true, it overrides UseCache and CacheKey. Instead, ForcedCacheKey is used.

StringVectorProperty.name: RepresentationTypesInfo
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Property that lists the available representation types. This is used by the domain for "Representation" to setup the list of types available correctly.

StringVectorProperty.name: Representation
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Choose the type for the representation.

IntVectorProperty.name: Enabled
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Enable/Disable widget interaction.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: SMTK Highlight Color
DoubleVectorProperty.name: SMTKHighlightColor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Color used to highlight model or mesh components.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Default Face Color
DoubleVectorProperty.name: DefaultFaceColor
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Default color for model or mesh faces.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Background color for items with default values
DoubleVectorProperty.name: SMTKDefaultValueBackground
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Color for attribute items holding default values.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Background color for items with invalid values
DoubleVectorProperty.name: SMTKInvalidValueBackground
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Color for attribute items holding invalid values.

PropertyGroup.label: SMTK Colors
PropertyGroup.Documentation: Colors used when displaying SMTK model and mesh components.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Position
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the position of the box.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: Scale
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the size of the box via a scale factor.

SettingsProxy.name: SMTKSettings
SettingsProxy.label: Sim Pre-processing
SettingsProxy.Documentation: Settings related to simulation modeling (pre-processing) with SMTK.

IntVectorProperty.name: HighlightOnHover
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Highlight rendered entities as the mouse hovers over widgets listing them.

IntVectorProperty.name: SelectionRenderStyle
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Should representations show selected components as solids or as wireframees?

IntVectorProperty.name: ResourceTreeStyle
IntVectorProperty.Documentation:
By default, resources are presented in a hierarchical fashion: only the top-level components appear beneath a resource. However, they may be expanded to list their children if they have any. For model entities, top-level components are those which do not serve as geometric boundaries for any others (if they are cells) or groups that are not members of any other group (if they are groups) or models that are not owned by any other model (if they are not models).
The alternative is a flatter, two-level hierarchy where, underneath each resource is a list of entity types. Each list of entity types has children that are the given type.

StringVectorProperty.name: WorkflowsFolder
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The default folder for simulation workflow files. Typically set to one specific simulation code (ACE3P, ADH, etc.), but can also be set to the top-level workflow folder to select from all simulation codes.

StringVectorProperty.name: ProjectsRootFolder
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The default parent folder for projects. If set, this path is used to initialize the file dialog for opening projects.

PropertyGroup.label: Display Options
PropertyGroup.Documentation: Options for how SMTK models are displayed in text widgets as well as 3-D render windows.
